title: Can you share unique facts worth 1234 upvotes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Some facts which are unique in their own way and can make you scratch your head in amazement too: Tibetan mastiff.These are guard dogs kept by herders to protect their cattles and yaks in my hometown- Bomdila and Tawang. We call them Bro khee. When they bark one can hear them from quite a distance. They are very huge.  Credit: to Imgur. 2. The dengue vector Aedes aegypti Females entertained with music attacked hosts much later than their non-entertained peers.  Credit: WTF fun facts. The occurrence of blood feeding activity was lower when music was being played. Adults exposed to music copulated far less often than their counterparts kept in an environment where there was no music. The observation that such music can delay host attack, reduce blood feeding, and disrupt mating provides new avenues for the development of music-based personal protective and control measures against Aedes-borne diseases.[1] 3. Dried Human Tears microscopic structure.  Credit: Smithsonian Magazine | Smithsonian Magazine Photographer Rose-Lynn Fisher captures tears of grief, joy, laughter and irritation in extreme detail. [2] 4. Three International women doctors in the year 1885 from the Woman’s Medical College of Pennsylvania (WMCP).  Credit: Shareably.net Three international students at the Woman’s Medical College of Pennsylvania in 1885: Dr. Anandibai Joshee, class of 1886, who was the first Indian woman to earn an MD; Japan’s Dr. Kei Okami, class of 1889, and Dr. Sabat Islambooly, class of 1890, from Syria. It was first women’s medical college in the world, and immediately began attracting foreign students unable to study medicine in their home countries.[3] 5. Napoleon Bonaparte's body part.  Credit: WTF Fun Facts - Funny, interesting, and weird facts As soon as Napoleon passed away, an autopsy was performed in 1821 so as to find out the reason for his death. During the autopsy, his heart and stomach were officially removed, and his doctor allegedly cut his penis off and gave it to a priest in Corsica. The assistant of the doctor who operated on Napoleon revealed that various other unspecified parts were already taken. The penis has been auctioned several times and displayed. It seems to be a genuine body part of the great conqueror, but no one quite agrees as to whether it is a penis or not. The preserved penis, about an inch long, has been described variously as a tendon, a piece of leather, a grape, and a shriveled sea horse. In 1977, an urologist living in New Jersey purchased the famous Napoleon’s penis for $3,000 and stored it under his bed until he died 30 years later. His daughter inherited Napoleon’s penis and has fielded at least one $100,000 offer.[4] 6. The bullet bra, Sweater girls of 40s,50s.  Credit: Dianna Prince YouTube. Bullet bras became popular in the 1950s, usually worn with tight-fitting outergarments to accentuate the shape of the bra and enhance the curves of the wearer. [5] 7. Brazilian man born with upside down head.  Credit: pic from YouTube. Claudio Viera de Oliveira was born with an upside head and deformed legs. After giving birth, his mother was told by doctors to allow him to die. But she ignored their advice and Claudio grew up to be independent . He has now launched his own book after writing about his experiences .[6] 8. Mr Toilet with respect from South Korea.  Credit: WTF fun facts. According to him, he was born in a toilet. "My mother believed that people born in bathrooms enjoyed longer lives." One of his close associates adds that "he literally began life in a toilet and his life ended in a commode shaped house." The Toilet-Shaped house is in Suwon, which is about 25 miles south of Seoul. While Sim was famously called "Mr. Toilet," and the house nicknamed the toilet house, that is not its official name. Instead, he named it Haewoojae, which signifies in Korean "a of sanctuary where one can solve one's worries." The house has two bedrooms, two guest rooms, and three "deluxe" bathrooms. The entire house is made of steel, white concrete, and glass. It also has a symbolic bowl-like opening in the roof.[7] 9. English man William Thompson’s scalp, Nebraska library.  Credit: to onlyinyourstate.com(You Won’t Believe The Bizarre Piece Of History Hiding In A Nebraska Library) In August 1867, Thompson an Englishman employed by the Union Pacific railroad in Omaha, was dispatched to the tiny town of Lexington, Nebraska to fix a broken telegraph wire. On his way, his train was attacked by 25 members of the Cheyenne tribe . [8] He was shot and his scalp was carved off of his skull. During the attack, Thompson fainted. When he become conscious he found his scalp with his flowing hair near him. The doctor was not able to fix it for him so he left for England along with the scalp. He send it back to the same doctor after few years ,who, in turn, donated it to the public library. 10. Symbol of loyalty, a Japanese dog.  Credit: WTF fun facts. 11. Auto Brewery Syndrome.  Credit: WTF fun facts or gut fermentation syndrome, is a rare condition that results in the production of ethanol (i.e. alcohol) in the stomach,which can cause symptoms similar to those of being drunk. 12. Prunes instead of cheese.  Credit: WTF fun facts. Footnotes[1] The electronic song “Scary Monsters and Nice Sprites” reduces host attack and mating success in the dengue vector Aedes aegypti[2] The Microscopic Structures of Dried Human Tears[3] From India, Japan and Syria, 19th Century Women Who Trekked to Philadelphia for Medical School[4] Napoleon’s penis was removed and sold for $3000 in 1977 - Mind Blowing Facts[5] Bullet Bra: The Indispensable Underwear for the Sweater Girl, 1940s - 1950s[6] The man with the upside-down head who still looks on the bright side[7] Do You Know About the Toilet House in South Korea? | Waterless Co Inc.[8] William Thompson's Scalped Scalp
